name: Grootbos Private Nature Reserve

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Maybe my expectations were too high after reading all the reviews of Grootbos, but being South African and having experienced so many different game lodges, I was slightly disappointed with Grootbos.
reviews.title: Maybe I expected too much?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It has fantastic views, perfect sunsets and wonderful food. Staff is very well trained and friendly. I loved the botanical nature walk.
reviews.title: "Enchanted Nature Preserve on Walker Bay"

reviews.text: Due to the rooms all facing straight into the setting sun it tends to get very hot in the rooms in the afternoon (even though there is an aircon) and the furniture & linen is sun bleached / worn.
reviews.title: Heaven is a place on earth!

reviews.text: I was also slightly surprised that Grootbos was the wrong side of the R43 (a main road) from the beach, as I got the impression from photos that it borders directly on the beach.
reviews.title: Most amazing weekend at Grootbos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Grootbos is a stunningly beautiful destination. The professional, gracious, attentiveness of the entire staff, complements the magnificent luxurious accommodations and delectable meals served at the restaurant. It is masterfully designed to take full advantage of the sweeping views of th ePreserve, a wildflower jungle and Walker Bay which is the Whale Watching and Great White Shark Viewing Capitol of the World. The Grootbos Nature Preserve is vast and beautiful, it can be experienced by hiking, on horseback or with experienced guides on a 4 x 4 Safari. It's a
reviews.title: Absolutely stunning

reviews.text: We stayed at Grootbos for 2 nights at the start of our African adventure....and what a great start!
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic rooms with incredible views, and amazing staff. Nothing was too much trouble, and the activities offered were great.
reviews.title: Wonderful Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The special dinner they put on for us on our second night to help celebrate our birthdays was fabulous.
reviews.title: A wonderfully relaxed weekend at Grootbos

reviews.text: A very memorable experience...thank you
reviews.title: Simply wonderful weekend

reviews.text: This is a long time coming. I know I should have done this as soon as we got back from our African Vacation/Safari end of September 2012. But as they say better late than never. Grootbos is a very lovely place, The forest Lodge was just awesome. Our suite was impeccable and the views were fantastic. To get to our suites is just like walking through the forest, so close to nature away from the hustle & bustle of the city.
reviews.title: Magnificent

reviews.text: We ate at the Indigo Restaurant at the Grootbos Nature Reserve as part of a deal whilst staying at the nearby Crayfish Lodge. The quality of the food and service was outstanding. If like us you are visiting during the South African winter it us worth getting there early and having a drink in the bar to make the most of the views.
reviews.title: Great food and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a gem! What a way to explore the fynbos and indigenous forest in the Overberg! We had a weekend in July free at short notice and were accommodated at Grootbos in one of the Forest Lodge chalets - spectacular view over the whole sweep of Walker Bay. The Lodge offers a variety of activities - we chose two morning walks and a wonderful stop/start drive through the fynbos and our informative guides were part of the entertainment - especially Jo. While all the meals were great, the dinners were works of art! And my husband said he had the best facial he has ever had. Grootbos will be a regular visit for us at least once a year in winter.
reviews.title: A fynbos gem

reviews.text: People cannot stop talking about our wedding that took place 9 August at the Forest lodge. This is just because it exceeded expectations. Despite the honeymoon suite having a blocked shower and a malfunctioning bath plug, we had fun. This started on the Thursday with a dinner and then the wedding/ wedding reception and all. The staff were great, nanny brilliant, food excellent (thanks Duane) and the weather made it perfect. Some say it is a hidden gem, which is true. Guests had activities in the morning of the wedding, which they enjoyed.
reviews.title: My perfect wedding at Grootbos

reviews.text: Staff worked as a team and I am grateful that they gave me a 5 star wedding.
reviews.title: Fantastic location, suites, meals, service; perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I mean, who has the privilege of having a ceremony overlooking the perfect views of the sea, canapés on an awesome sunset evening and reception in a stunning venue!
reviews.title: Special place

reviews.text: Grootbos is a wonderful resort overviewing the Walker Bay with very good chances to watch whales from the terraces and from the rooms. It is situated in a huge nature reserve and the whole team makes you feel at home immediately. We had a lovely room in the Garden Lodge and enjoyed every second of our stay. Michael and his team have created a wonderful place there. The food was excellent and always very nicely presented. All in all: a wonderful place to stay for a couple of days to enjoy nature and the fynbos, to watch whales or to just sit on the terrace enjoying life.
reviews.title: Nature and hospitality at its best
Expensive Waste of Time
reviews.text: The only reason we chose to go here was to see marine life. They certainly market that on their website, although as an "extra". When we got there, we were advised that the boat they use was out of service. There was no access to any other boat. If you are marketing the ability to see marine life, you need to have a plan B.

Expect a surly reply from the owner who was not even gracious enough to provide an apology, stating only that it's not his boat and is out of his control. True, but it's up to you to find a way to live up to the expectations that you set.
reviews.title: Good, but....

reviews.text: The food, however, was amazing, the staff were wonderful and the grounds were beautiful. Too bad that's not what we went there for.
reviews.title: Amazing Wedding

reviews.text: We stayed at the Garden Lodge, because we travelled with our children this time. Previously we stayed at the Forest Lodge, which I personally prefer.
reviews.title: Our Wedding at Grootbos Private Nature Reserve

description: Grootbos, with its two 5-star luxury lodges is spectacularly situated on the fynbos and forest clad hills overlooking the whale-watching haven of Walker Bay. Grootbos has carved a unique niche in the upmarket eco-lodge sector by specializing in the Cape region of South Africa’s world-renowned flora and marine biodiversity. This multi-award winning reserve is home to more than 740 different plant species, offers warm hospitality, excellent cuisine, fine wines and is a nature lover’s paradise.
